@robin_a_p Pizza or no pizza is irrelevant. We broke a technology barrier and tried something innovative. We are not apologetic about that.
@robin_a_p Thanks for asking as opposed to accusing like others. We tested the drone in real world conditions under the laws. (cont)
@TheBigBhookad I don't think police would just believe us. They have investigated and given us a clean chit. We didn't break any laws.
@advaitn That's your point of view. Sometimes a wall needs to be broken one brick at a time.
@TheBigBhookad The video shows you that the drone flew with the pizza. If the laws changed today
column4: we would send a pizza to your house today.

text: @TheBigBhookad Our question was: can a pizza be delivered by drone? We answered that question successfully. (cont)
@advaitn our purpose was to explore a new technology. we succeeded in that purpose. this is just the beginning.
@advaitn That is why we got a clean chit from the police as well. And don't believe everything you hear on the news these days.
@advaitn we tested the drone within the laws. the video is a great marketing tool but doesn't mean the drone
column4: video and test were fake.

text: @ashishjaveri If you were coming to our place because we fly pizzas
column4: maybe your criteria should change. The drone test wasn't a fake

text: @berges @jarnagandhi so you're saying our entire video was fake? wow
column4: we must be the world's best special effects co. Hollywood listening?

text: @advaitn It costs some guts
column4: which we had to try something new. And you tell us how to fake a video because ours was real. Watched it?

text: @robin_a_p You can judge the rest.
@robin_a_p The video can't be fake
column4: can it? We only claimed it was a test and we succeeded at it in within the boundaries of the law.

text: @berges @jarnagandhi We don't see any other pizzeria trying this out. So I guess we are the most gutsy pizzeria in India if nothing else.
